title: Anyone know this font?
content:
Hello all,

I desperatly need this font ID.

Thank you all,

Raul

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3kg_4887.jpg)

 [‹ Swirly script engravers font - it's driving me crazy](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230/http:/typophile.com/node/50139 "Go to previous forum topic") [A modern sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230/http:/typophile.com/node/50008 "Go to next forum topic")
author: akira6272

comments.content: Close but not exactly - [Normalise DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/normalise-din/), [DIN 17SB](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/din-17-sb/), [Scheme](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/scheme/), [Isonorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009110230/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=isonorm) - none of the ampersands match though...

To me, this looks exactly like the lettering from one of those Leroy Lettering Guide devices, or the machines they use to make the custom frames for your license plates. Someone must have made a font of it by now. The rounded strokes are characteristic of the mark of the ink-pen or routing tool used to shape the letters. It’s just been blown up to sign-size.

- Mike Yanega
